107static char *PAM_usr = NULL;
108static char *PAM_pwd = NULL;
109static int PAM_conv(int, const struct pam_message **,
110 struct pam_response **, void *);
111static struct pam_conv PAM_chat = { &PAM_conv, NULL };
112#endif

119
120void
121xauth_sendreq(iph1)
122 struct ph1handle *iph1;
123{
124 vchar_t *buffer;
125 struct isakmp_pl_attr *attr;
126 struct isakmp_data *typeattr;
127 struct isakmp_data *usrattr;
128 struct isakmp_data *pwdattr;
129 struct xauth_state *xst = &iph1->mode_cfg->xauth;
130 size_t tlen;
131
132 /* Status checks */
133 if (iph1->status < PHASE1ST_ESTABLISHED) {
134 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
135 "Xauth request while phase 1 is not completed\n");
136 return;
137 }
138
139 if (xst->status != XAUTHST_NOTYET) {
140 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
141 "Xauth request whith Xauth state %d\n", xst->status);
142 return;
143 }
144
145 plog(LLV_INFO, LOCATION, NULL, "Sending Xauth request\n");
146
147 tlen = sizeof(*attr) +
148 + sizeof(*typeattr) +
149 + sizeof(*usrattr) +
150 + sizeof(*pwdattr);
151
152 if ((buffer = vmalloc(tlen)) == NULL) {
153 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL, "Cannot allocate buffer\n");
154 return;
155 }
156
157 attr = (struct isakmp_pl_attr *)buffer->v;
158 memset(attr, 0, tlen);
159
160 attr->h.len = htons(tlen);
161 attr->type = ISAKMP_CFG_REQUEST;
162 attr->id = htons(eay_random());
163
164 typeattr = (struct isakmp_data *)(attr + 1);
165 typeattr->type = htons(XAUTH_TYPE | ISAKMP_GEN_TV);
166 typeattr->lorv = htons(XAUTH_TYPE_GENERIC);
167
168 usrattr = (struct isakmp_data *)(typeattr + 1);
169 usrattr->type = htons(XAUTH_USER_NAME | ISAKMP_GEN_TLV);
170 usrattr->lorv = htons(0);
171
172 pwdattr = (struct isakmp_data *)(usrattr + 1);
173 pwdattr->type = htons(XAUTH_USER_PASSWORD | ISAKMP_GEN_TLV);
174 pwdattr->lorv = htons(0);
175
176 isakmp_cfg_send(iph1, buffer,
177 ISAKMP_NPTYPE_ATTR, ISAKMP_FLAG_E, 1);
178
179 vfree(buffer);
180
181 xst->status = XAUTHST_REQSENT;
182
183 return;
184}
185
186int
187xauth_attr_reply(iph1, attr, id)
188 struct ph1handle *iph1;
189 struct isakmp_data *attr;
190 int id;
191{
192 char **outlet = NULL;
193 size_t alen = 0;
194 int type;
195 struct xauth_state *xst = &iph1->mode_cfg->xauth;
196
197 if ((iph1->mode_cfg->flags & ISAKMP_CFG_VENDORID_XAUTH) == 0) {
198 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
199 "Xauth reply but peer did not declare "
200 "itself as Xauth capable\n");
201 return -1;
202 }
203
204 if (xst->status != XAUTHST_REQSENT) {
205 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
206 "Xauth reply while Xauth state is %d\n", xst->status);
207 return -1;
208 }
209
210 type = ntohs(attr->type) & ~ISAKMP_GEN_MASK;
211 switch (type) {
212 case XAUTH_TYPE:
213 switch (ntohs(attr->lorv)) {
214 case XAUTH_TYPE_GENERIC:
215 xst->authtype = XAUTH_TYPE_GENERIC;
216 break;
217 default:
218 plog(LLV_WARNING, LOCATION, NULL,
219 "Unexpected authentication type %d\n",
220 ntohs(type));
221 return -1;
222 }
223 break;
224
225 case XAUTH_USER_NAME:
226 outlet = &xst->authdata.generic.usr;
227 break;
228
229 case XAUTH_USER_PASSWORD:
230 outlet = &xst->authdata.generic.pwd;
231 break;
232
233 default:
234 plog(LLV_WARNING, LOCATION, NULL,
235 "ignored Xauth attribute %d\n", type);
236 break;
237 }
238
239 if (outlet != NULL) {
240 alen = ntohs(attr->lorv);
241
242 if ((*outlet = racoon_malloc(alen + 1)) == NULL) {
243 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
244 "Cannot allocate memory for Xauth Data\n");
245 return -1;
246 }
247
248 memcpy(*outlet, attr + 1, alen);
249 (*outlet)[alen] = '\0';
250 outlet = NULL;
251 }
252
253
254 if ((xst->authdata.generic.usr != NULL) &&
255 (xst->authdata.generic.pwd != NULL)) {
256 int port;
257 int res;
258 char *usr = xst->authdata.generic.usr;
259 char *pwd = xst->authdata.generic.pwd;
260 time_t throttle_delay = 0;
261
262#if 0 /* Real debug, don't do that at home */
263 plog(LLV_DEBUG, LOCATION, NULL,
264 "Got username \"%s\", password \"%s\"\n", usr, pwd);
265#endif
266 strncpy(iph1->mode_cfg->login, usr, LOGINLEN);
267 iph1->mode_cfg->login[LOGINLEN] = '\0';
268
269 res = -1;
270 if ((port = isakmp_cfg_getport(iph1)) == -1) {
271 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
272 "Port pool depleted\n");
273 goto skip_auth;
274 }
275
276 switch (isakmp_cfg_config.authsource) {
277 case ISAKMP_CFG_AUTH_SYSTEM:
278 res = privsep_xauth_login_system(usr, pwd);
279 break;
280#ifdef HAVE_LIBRADIUS
281 case ISAKMP_CFG_AUTH_RADIUS:
282 res = xauth_login_radius(iph1, usr, pwd);
283 break;
284#endif
285#ifdef HAVE_LIBPAM
286 case ISAKMP_CFG_AUTH_PAM:
287 res = privsep_xauth_login_pam(iph1->mode_cfg->port,
288 iph1->remote, usr, pwd);
289 break;
290#endif
291#ifdef HAVE_LIBLDAP
292 case ISAKMP_CFG_AUTH_LDAP:
293 res = xauth_login_ldap(iph1, usr, pwd);
294 break;
295#endif
296 default:
297 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
298 "Unexpected authentication source\n");
299 res = -1;
300 break;
301 }
302
303 /*
304 * Optional group authentication
305 */
306 if (!res && (isakmp_cfg_config.groupcount))
307 res = group_check(iph1,
308 isakmp_cfg_config.grouplist,
309 isakmp_cfg_config.groupcount);
310
311 /*
312 * On failure, throttle the connexion for the remote host
313 * in order to make password attacks more difficult.
314 */
315 throttle_delay = throttle_host(iph1->remote, res);
316 if (throttle_delay > 0) {
317 char *str;
318
319 str = saddrwop2str(iph1->remote);
320
321 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
322 "Throttling in action for %s: delay %lds\n",
323 str, (unsigned long)throttle_delay);
324 res = -1;
325 } else {
326 throttle_delay = 0;
327 }
328
329skip_auth:
330 if (throttle_delay != 0) {
331 struct xauth_reply_arg *xra;
332
333 if ((xra = racoon_calloc(1, sizeof(*xra))) == NULL) {
334 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
335 "malloc failed, bypass throttling\n");
336 return xauth_reply(iph1, port, id, res);
337 }
338
339 /*
340 * We need to store the ph1, but it might have
341 * disapeared when xauth_reply is called, so
342 * store the index instead.
343 */
344 xra->index = iph1->index;
345 xra->port = port;
346 xra->id = id;
347 xra->res = res;
348 sched_schedule(&xra->sc, throttle_delay,
349 xauth_reply_stub);
350 } else {
351 return xauth_reply(iph1, port, id, res);
352 }
353 }
354
355 return 0;
356}
357
358void
359xauth_reply_stub(sc)
360 struct sched *sc;
361{
362 struct xauth_reply_arg *xra = container_of(sc, struct xauth_reply_arg, sc);
363 struct ph1handle *iph1;
364
365 if ((iph1 = getph1byindex(&xra->index)) != NULL)
366 (void)xauth_reply(iph1, xra->port, xra->id, xra->res);
367 else
368 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
369 "Delayed Xauth reply: phase 1 no longer exists.\n");
370
371 racoon_free(xra);
372}
373
374int
375xauth_reply(struct ph1handle *iph1, int port, int id, int res)
376{
377 struct xauth_state *xst = &iph1->mode_cfg->xauth;
378 char *usr = xst->authdata.generic.usr;
379
380 if (res != 0) {
381 if (port != -1)
382 isakmp_cfg_putport(iph1, port);
383
384 plog(LLV_INFO, LOCATION, NULL,
385 "login failed for user \"%s\"\n", usr);
386
387 xauth_sendstatus(iph1, XAUTH_STATUS_FAIL, id);
388 xst->status = XAUTHST_NOTYET;
389
390 /* Delete Phase 1 SA */
391 if (iph1->status >= PHASE1ST_ESTABLISHED)
392 isakmp_info_send_d1(iph1);
393 remph1(iph1);
394 delph1(iph1);
395
396 return -1;
397 }
398
399 xst->status = XAUTHST_OK;
400 plog(LLV_INFO, LOCATION, NULL,
401 "login succeeded for user \"%s\"\n", usr);
402
403 xauth_sendstatus(iph1, XAUTH_STATUS_OK, id);
404
405 return 0;
406}
407
408void
409xauth_sendstatus(iph1, status, id)
410 struct ph1handle *iph1;
411 int status;
412 int id;
413{
414 vchar_t *buffer;
415 struct isakmp_pl_attr *attr;
416 struct isakmp_data *stattr;
417 size_t tlen;
418
419 tlen = sizeof(*attr) +
420 + sizeof(*stattr);
421
422 if ((buffer = vmalloc(tlen)) == NULL) {
423 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL, "Cannot allocate buffer\n");
424 return;
425 }
426
427 attr = (struct isakmp_pl_attr *)buffer->v;
428 memset(attr, 0, tlen);
429
430 attr->h.len = htons(tlen);
431 attr->type = ISAKMP_CFG_SET;
432 attr->id = htons(id);
433
434 stattr = (struct isakmp_data *)(attr + 1);
435 stattr->type = htons(XAUTH_STATUS | ISAKMP_GEN_TV);
436 stattr->lorv = htons(status);
437
438 isakmp_cfg_send(iph1, buffer,
439 ISAKMP_NPTYPE_ATTR, ISAKMP_FLAG_E, 1);
440
441 vfree(buffer);
442
443 return;
444}
445
446#ifdef HAVE_LIBRADIUS
447int
448xauth_radius_init_conf(int free)
449{
450 /* free radius config resources */
451 if (free) {
452 int i;
453 for (i = 0; i < xauth_rad_config.auth_server_count; i++) {
454 vfree(xauth_rad_config.auth_server_list[i].host);
455 vfree(xauth_rad_config.auth_server_list[i].secret);
456 }
457 for (i = 0; i < xauth_rad_config.acct_server_count; i++) {
458 vfree(xauth_rad_config.acct_server_list[i].host);
459 vfree(xauth_rad_config.acct_server_list[i].secret);
460 }
461 if (radius_auth_state != NULL) {
462 rad_close(radius_auth_state);
463 radius_auth_state = NULL;
464 }
465 if (radius_acct_state != NULL) {
466 rad_close(radius_acct_state);
467 radius_acct_state = NULL;
468 }
469 }
470
471 /* initialize radius config */
472 memset(&xauth_rad_config, 0, sizeof(xauth_rad_config));
473 return 0;
474}
475
476int
477xauth_radius_init(void)
478{
479 /* For first time use, initialize Radius */
480 if ((isakmp_cfg_config.authsource == ISAKMP_CFG_AUTH_RADIUS) &&
481 (radius_auth_state == NULL)) {
482 if ((radius_auth_state = rad_auth_open()) == NULL) {
483 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
484 "Cannot init libradius\n");
485 return -1;
486 }
487
488 int auth_count = xauth_rad_config.auth_server_count;
489 int auth_added = 0;
490 if (auth_count) {
491 int i;
492 for (i = 0; i < auth_count; i++) {
493 if(!rad_add_server(
494 radius_auth_state,
495 xauth_rad_config.auth_server_list[i].host->v,
496 xauth_rad_config.auth_server_list[i].port,
497 xauth_rad_config.auth_server_list[i].secret->v,
498 xauth_rad_config.timeout,
499 xauth_rad_config.retries ))
500 auth_added++;
501 else
502 plog(LLV_WARNING, LOCATION, NULL,
503 "could not add radius auth server %s\n",
504 xauth_rad_config.auth_server_list[i].host->v);
505 }
506 }
507
508 if (!auth_added) {
509 if (rad_config(radius_auth_state, NULL) != 0) {
510 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
511 "Cannot open libradius config file: %s\n",
512 rad_strerror(radius_auth_state));
513 rad_close(radius_auth_state);
514 radius_auth_state = NULL;
515 return -1;
516 }
517 }
518 }
519
520 if ((isakmp_cfg_config.accounting == ISAKMP_CFG_ACCT_RADIUS) &&
521 (radius_acct_state == NULL)) {
522 if ((radius_acct_state = rad_acct_open()) == NULL) {
523 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
524 "Cannot init libradius\n");
525 return -1;
526 }
527
528 int acct_count = xauth_rad_config.acct_server_count;
529 int acct_added = 0;
530 if (acct_count) {
531 int i;
532 for (i = 0; i < acct_count; i++) {
533 if(!rad_add_server(
534 radius_acct_state,
535 xauth_rad_config.acct_server_list[i].host->v,
536 xauth_rad_config.acct_server_list[i].port,
537 xauth_rad_config.acct_server_list[i].secret->v,
538 xauth_rad_config.timeout,
539 xauth_rad_config.retries ))
540 acct_added++;
541 else
542 plog(LLV_WARNING, LOCATION, NULL,
543 "could not add radius account server %s\n",
544 xauth_rad_config.acct_server_list[i].host->v);
545 }
546 }
547
548 if (!acct_added) {
549 if (rad_config(radius_acct_state, NULL) != 0) {
550 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
551 "Cannot open libradius config file: %s\n",
552 rad_strerror(radius_acct_state));
553 rad_close(radius_acct_state);
554 radius_acct_state = NULL;
555 return -1;
556 }
557 }
558 }
559
560 return 0;
561}
562
563int
564xauth_login_radius(iph1, usr, pwd)
565 struct ph1handle *iph1;
566 char *usr;
567 char *pwd;
568{
569 int res;
570 const void *data;
571 size_t len;
572 int type;
573
574 if (rad_create_request(radius_auth_state, RAD_ACCESS_REQUEST) != 0) {
575 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
576 "rad_create_request failed: %s\n",
577 rad_strerror(radius_auth_state));
578 return -1;
579 }
580
581 if (rad_put_string(radius_auth_state, RAD_USER_NAME, usr) != 0) {
582 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
583 "rad_put_string failed: %s\n",
584 rad_strerror(radius_auth_state));
585 return -1;
586 }
587
588 if (rad_put_string(radius_auth_state, RAD_USER_PASSWORD, pwd) != 0) {
589 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
590 "rad_put_string failed: %s\n",
591 rad_strerror(radius_auth_state));
592 return -1;
593 }
594
595 if (rad_put_string(radius_auth_state, RAD_CALLING_STATION_ID,
596 saddr2str(iph1->remote)) != 0)
597 return -1;
598
599 if (isakmp_cfg_radius_common(radius_auth_state, iph1->mode_cfg->port) != 0)
600 return -1;
601
602 switch (res = rad_send_request(radius_auth_state)) {
603 case RAD_ACCESS_ACCEPT:
604 while ((type = rad_get_attr(radius_auth_state, &data, &len)) != 0) {
605 switch (type) {
606 case RAD_FRAMED_IP_ADDRESS:
607 iph1->mode_cfg->addr4 = rad_cvt_addr(data);
608 iph1->mode_cfg->flags
609 |= ISAKMP_CFG_ADDR4_EXTERN;
610 break;
611
612 case RAD_FRAMED_IP_NETMASK:
613 iph1->mode_cfg->mask4 = rad_cvt_addr(data);
614 iph1->mode_cfg->flags
615 |= ISAKMP_CFG_MASK4_EXTERN;
616 break;
617
618 default:
619 plog(LLV_INFO, LOCATION, NULL,
620 "Unexpected attribute: %d\n", type);
621 break;
622 }
623 }
624
625 return 0;
626 break;
627
628 case RAD_ACCESS_REJECT:
629 return -1;
630 break;
631
632 case -1:
633 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
634 "rad_send_request failed: %s\n",
635 rad_strerror(radius_auth_state));
636 return -1;
637 break;
638 default:
639 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
640 "rad_send_request returned %d\n", res);
641 return -1;
642 break;
643 }
644
645 return -1;
646}
647#endif
648
649#ifdef HAVE_LIBPAM
650static int
651PAM_conv(msg_count, msg, rsp, dontcare)
652 int msg_count;
653 const struct pam_message **msg;
654 struct pam_response **rsp;
655 void *dontcare;
656{
657 int i;
658 struct pam_response *reply = NULL;
659
660 if ((reply = racoon_malloc(sizeof(*reply) * msg_count)) == NULL)
661 return PAM_CONV_ERR;
662 bzero(reply, sizeof(*reply) * msg_count);
663
664 for (i = 0; i < msg_count; i++) {
665 switch (msg[i]->msg_style) {
666 case PAM_PROMPT_ECHO_ON:
667 /* Send the username, libpam frees resp */
668 reply[i].resp_retcode = PAM_SUCCESS;
669 if ((reply[i].resp = strdup(PAM_usr)) == NULL) {
670 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION,
671 NULL, "strdup failed\n");
672 exit(1);
673 }
674 break;
675
676 case PAM_PROMPT_ECHO_OFF:
677 /* Send the password, libpam frees resp */
678 reply[i].resp_retcode = PAM_SUCCESS;
679 if ((reply[i].resp = strdup(PAM_pwd)) == NULL) {
680 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION,
681 NULL, "strdup failed\n");
682 exit(1);
683 }
684 break;
685
686 case PAM_TEXT_INFO:
687 case PAM_ERROR_MSG:
688 reply[i].resp_retcode = PAM_SUCCESS;
689 reply[i].resp = NULL;
690 break;
691
692 default:
693 if (reply != NULL)
694 racoon_free(reply);
695 return PAM_CONV_ERR;
696 break;
697 }
698 }
699
700 if (reply != NULL)
701 *rsp = reply;
702
703 return PAM_SUCCESS;
704}
705
706int
707xauth_login_pam(port, raddr, usr, pwd)
708 int port;
709 struct sockaddr *raddr;
710 char *usr;
711 char *pwd;
712{
713 int error;
714 char *remote = NULL;
715 pam_handle_t *pam = NULL;
716
717 if (isakmp_cfg_config.port_pool == NULL) {
718 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
719 "isakmp_cfg_config.port_pool == NULL\n");
720 return -1;
721 }
722
723 if ((error = pam_start("racoon", usr,
724 &PAM_chat, &isakmp_cfg_config.port_pool[port].pam)) != 0) {
725 if (isakmp_cfg_config.port_pool[port].pam == NULL) {
726 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL, "pam_start failed\n");
727 return -1;
728 } else {
729 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
730 "pam_start failed: %s\n",
731 pam_strerror(isakmp_cfg_config.port_pool[port].pam,
732 error));
733 goto out;
734 }
735 }
736 pam = isakmp_cfg_config.port_pool[port].pam;
737
738 if ((remote = strdup(saddrwop2str(raddr))) == NULL) {
739 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
740 "cannot allocate memory: %s\n", strerror(errno));
741 goto out;
742 }
743
744 if ((error = pam_set_item(pam, PAM_RHOST, remote)) != 0) {
745 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
746 "pam_set_item failed: %s\n",
747 pam_strerror(pam, error));
748 goto out;
749 }
750
751 if ((error = pam_set_item(pam, PAM_RUSER, usr)) != 0) {
752 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
753 "pam_set_item failed: %s\n",
754 pam_strerror(pam, error));
755 goto out;
756 }
757
758 PAM_usr = usr;
759 PAM_pwd = pwd;
760 error = pam_authenticate(pam, 0);
761 PAM_usr = NULL;
762 PAM_pwd = NULL;
763 if (error != 0) {
764 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
765 "pam_authenticate failed: %s\n",
766 pam_strerror(pam, error));
767 goto out;
768 }
769
770 if ((error = pam_acct_mgmt(pam, 0)) != 0) {
771 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
772 "pam_acct_mgmt failed: %s\n",
773 pam_strerror(pam, error));
774 goto out;
775 }
776
777 if ((error = pam_setcred(pam, 0)) != 0) {
778 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
779 "pam_setcred failed: %s\n",
780 pam_strerror(pam, error));
781 goto out;
782 }
783
784 if (remote != NULL)
785 free(remote);
786
787 return 0;
788
789out:
790 pam_end(pam, error);
791 isakmp_cfg_config.port_pool[port].pam = NULL;
792 if (remote != NULL)
793 free(remote);
794 return -1;
795}
796#endif
797
798#ifdef HAVE_LIBLDAP
799int
800xauth_ldap_init_conf(void)
801{
802 int tmplen;
803 int error = -1;
804
805 xauth_ldap_config.pver = 3;
806 xauth_ldap_config.host = NULL;
807 xauth_ldap_config.port = LDAP_PORT;
808 xauth_ldap_config.tls = 0;
809 xauth_ldap_config.base = NULL;
810 xauth_ldap_config.subtree = 0;
811 xauth_ldap_config.bind_dn = NULL;
812 xauth_ldap_config.bind_pw = NULL;
813 xauth_ldap_config.auth_type = LDAP_AUTH_SIMPLE;
814 xauth_ldap_config.attr_user = NULL;
815 xauth_ldap_config.attr_addr = NULL;
816 xauth_ldap_config.attr_mask = NULL;
817 xauth_ldap_config.attr_group = NULL;
818 xauth_ldap_config.attr_member = NULL;
819
820 /* set default host */
821 tmplen = strlen(LDAP_DFLT_HOST);
822 xauth_ldap_config.host = vmalloc(tmplen);
823 if (xauth_ldap_config.host == NULL)
824 goto out;
825 memcpy(xauth_ldap_config.host->v, LDAP_DFLT_HOST, tmplen);
826
827 /* set default user naming attribute */
828 tmplen = strlen(LDAP_DFLT_USER);
829 xauth_ldap_config.attr_user = vmalloc(tmplen);
830 if (xauth_ldap_config.attr_user == NULL)
831 goto out;
832 memcpy(xauth_ldap_config.attr_user->v, LDAP_DFLT_USER, tmplen);
833
834 /* set default address attribute */
835 tmplen = strlen(LDAP_DFLT_ADDR);
836 xauth_ldap_config.attr_addr = vmalloc(tmplen);
837 if (xauth_ldap_config.attr_addr == NULL)
838 goto out;
839 memcpy(xauth_ldap_config.attr_addr->v, LDAP_DFLT_ADDR, tmplen);
840
841 /* set default netmask attribute */
842 tmplen = strlen(LDAP_DFLT_MASK);
843 xauth_ldap_config.attr_mask = vmalloc(tmplen);
844 if (xauth_ldap_config.attr_mask == NULL)
845 goto out;
846 memcpy(xauth_ldap_config.attr_mask->v, LDAP_DFLT_MASK, tmplen);
847
848 /* set default group naming attribute */
849 tmplen = strlen(LDAP_DFLT_GROUP);
850 xauth_ldap_config.attr_group = vmalloc(tmplen);
851 if (xauth_ldap_config.attr_group == NULL)
852 goto out;
853 memcpy(xauth_ldap_config.attr_group->v, LDAP_DFLT_GROUP, tmplen);
854
855 /* set default member attribute */
856 tmplen = strlen(LDAP_DFLT_MEMBER);
857 xauth_ldap_config.attr_member = vmalloc(tmplen);
858 if (xauth_ldap_config.attr_member == NULL)
859 goto out;
860 memcpy(xauth_ldap_config.attr_member->v, LDAP_DFLT_MEMBER, tmplen);
861
862 error = 0;
863out:
864 if (error != 0)
865 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL, "cannot allocate memory\n");
866
867 return error;
868}
869
870int
871xauth_login_ldap(iph1, usr, pwd)
872 struct ph1handle *iph1;
873 char *usr;
874 char *pwd;
875{
876 int rtn = -1;
877 int res = -1;
878 LDAP *ld = NULL;
879 LDAPMessage *lr = NULL;
880 LDAPMessage *le = NULL;
881 struct berval cred;
882 struct berval **bv = NULL;
883 struct timeval timeout;
884 char *init = NULL;
885 char *filter = NULL;
886 char *atlist[3];
887 char *basedn = NULL;
888 char *userdn = NULL;
889 int tmplen = 0;
890 int ecount = 0;
891 int scope = LDAP_SCOPE_ONE;
892
893 atlist[0] = NULL;
894 atlist[1] = NULL;
895 atlist[2] = NULL;
896
897 /* build our initialization url */
898 tmplen = strlen("ldap://:") + 17;
899 tmplen += strlen(xauth_ldap_config.host->v);
900 init = racoon_malloc(tmplen);
901 if (init == NULL) {
902 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
903 "unable to alloc ldap init url\n");
904 goto ldap_end;
905 }
906 sprintf(init,"ldap://%s:%d",
907 xauth_ldap_config.host->v,
908 xauth_ldap_config.port );
909
910 /* initialize the ldap handle */
911 res = ldap_initialize(&ld, init);
912 if (res != LDAP_SUCCESS) {
913 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
914 "ldap_initialize failed: %s\n",
915 ldap_err2string(res));
916 goto ldap_end;
917 }
918
919 /* initialize the protocol version */
920 ldap_set_option(ld, LDAP_OPT_PROTOCOL_VERSION,
921 &xauth_ldap_config.pver);
922
923 /* Enable TLS */
924 if (xauth_ldap_config.tls) {
925 res = ldap_start_tls_s(ld, NULL, NULL);
926 if (res != LDAP_SUCCESS) {
927 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
928 "ldap_start_tls_s failed: %s\n",
929 ldap_err2string(res));
930 goto ldap_end;
931 }
932 }
933
934 /*
935 * attempt to bind to the ldap server.
936 * default to anonymous bind unless a
937 * user dn and password has been
938 * specified in our configuration
939 */
940 if ((xauth_ldap_config.bind_dn != NULL)&&
941 (xauth_ldap_config.bind_pw != NULL))
942 {
943 cred.bv_val = xauth_ldap_config.bind_pw->v;
944 cred.bv_len = strlen( cred.bv_val );
945 res = ldap_sasl_bind_s(ld,
946 xauth_ldap_config.bind_dn->v, NULL, &cred,
947 NULL, NULL, NULL);
948 }
949 else
950 {
951 res = ldap_sasl_bind_s(ld,
952 NULL, NULL, NULL,
953 NULL, NULL, NULL);
954 }
955
956 if (res!=LDAP_SUCCESS) {
957 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
958 "ldap_sasl_bind_s (search) failed: %s\n",
959 ldap_err2string(res));
960 goto ldap_end;
961 }
962
963 /* build an ldap user search filter */
964 tmplen = strlen(xauth_ldap_config.attr_user->v);
965 tmplen += 1;
966 tmplen += strlen(usr);
967 tmplen += 1;
968 filter = racoon_malloc(tmplen);
969 if (filter == NULL) {
970 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
971 "unable to alloc ldap search filter buffer\n");
972 goto ldap_end;
973 }
974 sprintf(filter, "%s=%s",
975 xauth_ldap_config.attr_user->v, usr);
976
977 /* build our return attribute list */
978 tmplen = strlen(xauth_ldap_config.attr_addr->v) + 1;
979 atlist[0] = racoon_malloc(tmplen);
980 tmplen = strlen(xauth_ldap_config.attr_mask->v) + 1;
981 atlist[1] = racoon_malloc(tmplen);
982 if ((atlist[0] == NULL)||(atlist[1] == NULL)) {
983 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
984 "unable to alloc ldap attrib list buffer\n");
985 goto ldap_end;
986 }
987 strcpy(atlist[0],xauth_ldap_config.attr_addr->v);
988 strcpy(atlist[1],xauth_ldap_config.attr_mask->v);
989
990 /* attempt to locate the user dn */
991 if (xauth_ldap_config.base != NULL)
992 basedn = xauth_ldap_config.base->v;
993 if (xauth_ldap_config.subtree)
994 scope = LDAP_SCOPE_SUBTREE;
995 timeout.tv_sec = 15;
996 timeout.tv_usec = 0;
997 res = ldap_search_ext_s(ld, basedn, scope,
998 filter, atlist, 0, NULL, NULL,
999 &timeout, 2, &lr);
1000 if (res != LDAP_SUCCESS) {
1001 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1002 "ldap_search_ext_s failed: %s\n",
1003 ldap_err2string(res));
1004 goto ldap_end;
1005 }
1006
1007 /* check the number of ldap entries returned */
1008 ecount = ldap_count_entries(ld, lr);
1009 if (ecount < 1) {
1010 plog(LLV_WARNING, LOCATION, NULL,
1011 "no ldap results for filter \'%s\'\n",
1012 filter);
1013 goto ldap_end;
1014 }
1015 if (ecount > 1) {
1016 plog(LLV_WARNING, LOCATION, NULL,
1017 "multiple (%i) ldap results for filter \'%s\'\n",
1018 ecount, filter);
1019 }
1020
1021 /* obtain the dn from the first result */
1022 le = ldap_first_entry(ld, lr);
1023 if (le == NULL) {
1024 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1025 "ldap_first_entry failed: invalid entry returned\n");
1026 goto ldap_end;
1027 }
1028 userdn = ldap_get_dn(ld, le);
1029 if (userdn == NULL) {
1030 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1031 "ldap_get_dn failed: invalid string returned\n");
1032 goto ldap_end;
1033 }
1034
1035 /* cache the user dn in the xauth state */
1036 iph1->mode_cfg->xauth.udn = racoon_malloc(strlen(userdn)+1);
1037 strcpy(iph1->mode_cfg->xauth.udn,userdn);
1038
1039 /* retrieve modecfg address */
1040 bv = ldap_get_values_len(ld, le, xauth_ldap_config.attr_addr->v);
1041 if (bv != NULL) {
1042 char tmpaddr[16];
1043 /* sanity check for address value */
1044 if ((bv[0]->bv_len < 7)||(bv[0]->bv_len > 15)) {
1045 plog(LLV_DEBUG, LOCATION, NULL,
1046 "ldap returned invalid modecfg address\n");
1047 ldap_value_free_len(bv);
1048 goto ldap_end;
1049 }
1050 memcpy(tmpaddr,bv[0]->bv_val,bv[0]->bv_len);
1051 tmpaddr[bv[0]->bv_len]=0;
1052 iph1->mode_cfg->addr4.s_addr = inet_addr(tmpaddr);
1053 iph1->mode_cfg->flags |= ISAKMP_CFG_ADDR4_EXTERN;
1054 plog(LLV_INFO, LOCATION, NULL,
1055 "ldap returned modecfg address %s\n", tmpaddr);
1056 ldap_value_free_len(bv);
1057 }
1058
1059 /* retrieve modecfg netmask */
1060 bv = ldap_get_values_len(ld, le, xauth_ldap_config.attr_mask->v);
1061 if (bv != NULL) {
1062 char tmpmask[16];
1063 /* sanity check for netmask value */
1064 if ((bv[0]->bv_len < 7)||(bv[0]->bv_len > 15)) {
1065 plog(LLV_DEBUG, LOCATION, NULL,
1066 "ldap returned invalid modecfg netmask\n");
1067 ldap_value_free_len(bv);
1068 goto ldap_end;
1069 }
1070 memcpy(tmpmask,bv[0]->bv_val,bv[0]->bv_len);
1071 tmpmask[bv[0]->bv_len]=0;
1072 iph1->mode_cfg->mask4.s_addr = inet_addr(tmpmask);
1073 iph1->mode_cfg->flags |= ISAKMP_CFG_MASK4_EXTERN;
1074 plog(LLV_INFO, LOCATION, NULL,
1075 "ldap returned modecfg netmask %s\n", tmpmask);
1076 ldap_value_free_len(bv);
1077 }
1078
1079 /*
1080 * finally, use the dn and the xauth
1081 * password to check the users given
1082 * credentials by attempting to bind
1083 * to the ldap server
1084 */
1085 plog(LLV_INFO, LOCATION, NULL,
1086 "attempting ldap bind for dn \'%s\'\n", userdn);
1087 cred.bv_val = pwd;
1088 cred.bv_len = strlen( cred.bv_val );
1089 res = ldap_sasl_bind_s(ld,
1090 userdn, NULL, &cred,
1091 NULL, NULL, NULL);
1092 if(res==LDAP_SUCCESS)
1093 rtn = 0;
1094
1095ldap_end:
1096
1097 /* free ldap resources */
1098 if (userdn != NULL)
1099 ldap_memfree(userdn);
1100 if (atlist[0] != NULL)
1101 racoon_free(atlist[0]);
1102 if (atlist[1] != NULL)
1103 racoon_free(atlist[1]);
1104 if (filter != NULL)
1105 racoon_free(filter);
1106 if (lr != NULL)
1107 ldap_msgfree(lr);
1108 if (init != NULL)
1109 racoon_free(init);
1110
1111 ldap_unbind_ext_s(ld, NULL, NULL);
1112
1113 return rtn;
1114}
1115
1116int
1117xauth_group_ldap(udn, grp)
1118 char * udn;
1119 char * grp;
1120{
1121 int rtn = -1;
1122 int res = -1;
1123 LDAP *ld = NULL;
1124 LDAPMessage *lr = NULL;
1125 LDAPMessage *le = NULL;
1126 struct berval cred;
1127 struct timeval timeout;
1128 char *init = NULL;
1129 char *filter = NULL;
1130 char *basedn = NULL;
1131 char *groupdn = NULL;
1132 int tmplen = 0;
1133 int ecount = 0;
1134 int scope = LDAP_SCOPE_ONE;
1135
1136 /* build our initialization url */
1137 tmplen = strlen("ldap://:") + 17;
1138 tmplen += strlen(xauth_ldap_config.host->v);
1139 init = racoon_malloc(tmplen);
1140 if (init == NULL) {
1141 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1142 "unable to alloc ldap init url\n");
1143 goto ldap_group_end;
1144 }
1145 sprintf(init,"ldap://%s:%d",
1146 xauth_ldap_config.host->v,
1147 xauth_ldap_config.port );
1148
1149 /* initialize the ldap handle */
1150 res = ldap_initialize(&ld, init);
1151 if (res != LDAP_SUCCESS) {
1152 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1153 "ldap_initialize failed: %s\n",
1154 ldap_err2string(res));
1155 goto ldap_group_end;
1156 }
1157
1158 /* initialize the protocol version */
1159 ldap_set_option(ld, LDAP_OPT_PROTOCOL_VERSION,
1160 &xauth_ldap_config.pver);
1161
1162 /* Enable TLS */
1163 if (xauth_ldap_config.tls) {
1164 res = ldap_start_tls_s(ld, NULL, NULL);
1165 if (res != LDAP_SUCCESS) {
1166 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1167 "ldap_start_tls_s failed: %s\n",
1168 ldap_err2string(res));
1169 goto ldap_group_end;
1170 }
1171 }
1172
1173 /*
1174 * attempt to bind to the ldap server.
1175 * default to anonymous bind unless a
1176 * user dn and password has been
1177 * specified in our configuration
1178 */
1179 if ((xauth_ldap_config.bind_dn != NULL)&&
1180 (xauth_ldap_config.bind_pw != NULL))
1181 {
1182 cred.bv_val = xauth_ldap_config.bind_pw->v;
1183 cred.bv_len = strlen( cred.bv_val );
1184 res = ldap_sasl_bind_s(ld,
1185 xauth_ldap_config.bind_dn->v, NULL, &cred,
1186 NULL, NULL, NULL);
1187 }
1188 else
1189 {
1190 res = ldap_sasl_bind_s(ld,
1191 NULL, NULL, NULL,
1192 NULL, NULL, NULL);
1193 }
1194
1195 if (res!=LDAP_SUCCESS) {
1196 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1197 "ldap_sasl_bind_s (search) failed: %s\n",
1198 ldap_err2string(res));
1199 goto ldap_group_end;
1200 }
1201
1202 /* build an ldap group search filter */
1203 tmplen = strlen("(&(=)(=))") + 1;
1204 tmplen += strlen(xauth_ldap_config.attr_group->v);
1205 tmplen += strlen(grp);
1206 tmplen += strlen(xauth_ldap_config.attr_member->v);
1207 tmplen += strlen(udn);
1208 filter = racoon_malloc(tmplen);
1209 if (filter == NULL) {
1210 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1211 "unable to alloc ldap search filter buffer\n");
1212 goto ldap_group_end;
1213 }
1214 sprintf(filter, "(&(%s=%s)(%s=%s))",
1215 xauth_ldap_config.attr_group->v, grp,
1216 xauth_ldap_config.attr_member->v, udn);
1217
1218 /* attempt to locate the group dn */
1219 if (xauth_ldap_config.base != NULL)
1220 basedn = xauth_ldap_config.base->v;
1221 if (xauth_ldap_config.subtree)
1222 scope = LDAP_SCOPE_SUBTREE;
1223 timeout.tv_sec = 15;
1224 timeout.tv_usec = 0;
1225 res = ldap_search_ext_s(ld, basedn, scope,
1226 filter, NULL, 0, NULL, NULL,
1227 &timeout, 2, &lr);
1228 if (res != LDAP_SUCCESS) {
1229 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1230 "ldap_search_ext_s failed: %s\n",
1231 ldap_err2string(res));
1232 goto ldap_group_end;
1233 }
1234
1235 /* check the number of ldap entries returned */
1236 ecount = ldap_count_entries(ld, lr);
1237 if (ecount < 1) {
1238 plog(LLV_WARNING, LOCATION, NULL,
1239 "no ldap results for filter \'%s\'\n",
1240 filter);
1241 goto ldap_group_end;
1242 }
1243
1244 /* success */
1245 rtn = 0;
1246
1247 /* obtain the dn from the first result */
1248 le = ldap_first_entry(ld, lr);
1249 if (le == NULL) {
1250 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1251 "ldap_first_entry failed: invalid entry returned\n");
1252 goto ldap_group_end;
1253 }
1254 groupdn = ldap_get_dn(ld, le);
1255 if (groupdn == NULL) {
1256 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1257 "ldap_get_dn failed: invalid string returned\n");
1258 goto ldap_group_end;
1259 }
1260
1261 plog(LLV_INFO, LOCATION, NULL,
1262 "ldap membership group returned \'%s\'\n", groupdn);
1263ldap_group_end:
1264
1265 /* free ldap resources */
1266 if (groupdn != NULL)
1267 ldap_memfree(groupdn);
1268 if (filter != NULL)
1269 racoon_free(filter);
1270 if (lr != NULL)
1271 ldap_msgfree(lr);
1272 if (init != NULL)
1273 racoon_free(init);
1274
1275 ldap_unbind_ext_s(ld, NULL, NULL);
1276
1277 return rtn;
1278}
1279
1280#endif
1281
1282int
1283xauth_login_system(usr, pwd)
1284 char *usr;
1285 char *pwd;
1286{
1287 struct passwd *pw;
1288 char *cryptpwd;
1289 char *syscryptpwd;
1290#ifdef HAVE_SHADOW_H
1291 struct spwd *spw;
1292
1293 if ((spw = getspnam(usr)) == NULL)
1294 return -1;
1295
1296 syscryptpwd = spw->sp_pwdp;
1297#endif
1298
1299 if ((pw = getpwnam(usr)) == NULL)
1300 return -1;
1301
1302#ifndef HAVE_SHADOW_H
1303 syscryptpwd = pw->pw_passwd;
1304#endif
1305
1306 /* No root login. Ever. */
1307 if (pw->pw_uid == 0)
1308 return -1;
1309
1310 if ((cryptpwd = crypt(pwd, syscryptpwd)) == NULL)
1311 return -1;
1312
1313 if (strcmp(cryptpwd, syscryptpwd) == 0)
1314 return 0;
1315
1316 return -1;
1317}
1318
1319static int
1320xauth_group_system(char *usr, char *grp)
1321{
1322 struct group * gr;
1323 char * member;
1324 int index = 0;
1325
1326 gr = getgrnam(grp);
1327 if (gr == NULL) {
1328 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1329 "the system group name \'%s\' is unknown\n",
1330 grp);
1331 return -1;
1332 }
1333
1334 while ((member = gr->gr_mem[index++])!=NULL) {
1335 if (!strcmp(member,usr)) {
1336 plog(LLV_INFO, LOCATION, NULL,
1337 "membership validated\n");
1338 return 0;
1339 }
1340 }
1341
1342 return -1;
1343}
1344
1345int
1346xauth_check(iph1)
1347 struct ph1handle *iph1;
1348{
1349 struct xauth_state *xst = &iph1->mode_cfg->xauth;
1350
1351 /*
1352 * Only the server side (edge device) really check for Xauth
1353 * status. It does it if the chose authmethod is using Xauth.
1354 * On the client side (roadwarrior), we don't check anything.
1355 */
1356 switch (iph1->approval->authmethod) {
1357 case OAKLEY_ATTR_AUTH_METHOD_HYBRID_RSA_R:
1358 case OAKLEY_ATTR_AUTH_METHOD_XAUTH_RSASIG_R:
1359 case OAKLEY_ATTR_AUTH_METHOD_XAUTH_PSKEY_R:
1360 /* The following are not yet implemented */
1361 case OAKLEY_ATTR_AUTH_METHOD_HYBRID_DSS_R:
1362 case OAKLEY_ATTR_AUTH_METHOD_XAUTH_DSSSIG_R:
1363 case OAKLEY_ATTR_AUTH_METHOD_XAUTH_RSAENC_R:
1364 case OAKLEY_ATTR_AUTH_METHOD_XAUTH_RSAREV_R:
1365 if ((iph1->mode_cfg->flags & ISAKMP_CFG_VENDORID_XAUTH) == 0) {
1366 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1367 "Hybrid auth negotiated but peer did not "
1368 "announced as Xauth capable\n");
1369 return -1;
1370 }
1371
1372 if (xst->status != XAUTHST_OK) {
1373 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1374 "Hybrid auth negotiated but peer did not "
1375 "succeed Xauth exchange\n");
1376 return -1;
1377 }
1378
1379 return 0;
1380 break;
1381 default:
1382 return 0;
1383 break;
1384 }
1385
1386 return 0;
1387}
1388
1389int
1390group_check(iph1, grp_list, grp_count)
1391 struct ph1handle *iph1;
1392 char **grp_list;
1393 int grp_count;
1394{
1395 int res = -1;
1396 int grp_index = 0;
1397 char * usr = NULL;
1398
1399 /* check for presence of modecfg data */
1400
1401 if(iph1->mode_cfg == NULL) {
1402 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1403 "xauth group specified but modecfg not found\n");
1404 return res;
1405 }
1406
1407 /* loop through our group list */
1408
1409 for(; grp_index < grp_count; grp_index++) {
1410
1411 /* check for presence of xauth data */
1412
1413 usr = iph1->mode_cfg->xauth.authdata.generic.usr;
1414
1415 if(usr == NULL) {
1416 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1417 "xauth group specified but xauth not found\n");
1418 return res;
1419 }
1420
1421 /* call appropriate group validation funtion */
1422
1423 switch (isakmp_cfg_config.groupsource) {
1424
1425 case ISAKMP_CFG_GROUP_SYSTEM:
1426 res = xauth_group_system(
1427 usr,
1428 grp_list[grp_index]);
1429 break;
1430
1431#ifdef HAVE_LIBLDAP
1432 case ISAKMP_CFG_GROUP_LDAP:
1433 res = xauth_group_ldap(
1434 iph1->mode_cfg->xauth.udn,
1435 grp_list[grp_index]);
1436 break;
1437#endif
1438
1439 default:
1440 /* we should never get here */
1441 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1442 "Unknown group auth source\n");
1443 break;
1444 }
1445
1446 if( !res ) {
1447 plog(LLV_INFO, LOCATION, NULL,
1448 "user \"%s\" is a member of group \"%s\"\n",
1449 usr,
1450 grp_list[grp_index]);
1451 break;
1452 } else {
1453 plog(LLV_INFO, LOCATION, NULL,
1454 "user \"%s\" is not a member of group \"%s\"\n",
1455 usr,
1456 grp_list[grp_index]);
1457 }
1458 }
1459
1460 return res;
1461}
1462
1463vchar_t *
1464isakmp_xauth_req(iph1, attr)
1465 struct ph1handle *iph1;
1466 struct isakmp_data *attr;
1467{
1468 int type;
1469 size_t dlen = 0;
1470 int ashort = 0;
1471 int value = 0;
1472 vchar_t *buffer = NULL;
1473 char *mraw = NULL, *mdata;
1474 char *data;
1475 vchar_t *usr = NULL;
1476 vchar_t *pwd = NULL;
1477 size_t skip = 0;
1478 int freepwd = 0;
1479
1480 if ((iph1->mode_cfg->flags & ISAKMP_CFG_VENDORID_XAUTH) == 0) {
1481 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1482 "Xauth mode config request but peer "
1483 "did not declare itself as Xauth capable\n");
1484 return NULL;
1485 }
1486
1487 type = ntohs(attr->type) & ~ISAKMP_GEN_MASK;
1488
1489 /* Sanity checks */
1490 switch(type) {
1491 case XAUTH_TYPE:
1492 if ((ntohs(attr->type) & ISAKMP_GEN_TV) == 0) {
1493 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1494 "Unexpected long XAUTH_TYPE attribute\n");
1495 return NULL;
1496 }
1497 if (ntohs(attr->lorv) != XAUTH_TYPE_GENERIC) {
1498 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1499 "Unsupported Xauth authentication %d\n",
1500 ntohs(attr->lorv));
1501 return NULL;
1502 }
1503 ashort = 1;
1504 dlen = 0;
1505 value = XAUTH_TYPE_GENERIC;
1506 break;
1507
1508 case XAUTH_USER_NAME:
1509 if (!iph1->rmconf->xauth || !iph1->rmconf->xauth->login) {
1510 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL, "Xauth performed "
1511 "with no login supplied\n");
1512 return NULL;
1513 }
1514
1515 dlen = iph1->rmconf->xauth->login->l - 1;
1516 iph1->rmconf->xauth->state |= XAUTH_SENT_USERNAME;
1517 break;
1518
1519 case XAUTH_USER_PASSWORD:
1520 if (!iph1->rmconf->xauth || !iph1->rmconf->xauth->login)
1521 return NULL;
1522
1523 skip = sizeof(struct ipsecdoi_id_b);
1524 usr = vmalloc(iph1->rmconf->xauth->login->l - 1 + skip);
1525 if (usr == NULL) {
1526 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1527 "Cannot allocate memory\n");
1528 return NULL;
1529 }
1530 memset(usr->v, 0, skip);
1531 memcpy(usr->v + skip,
1532 iph1->rmconf->xauth->login->v,
1533 iph1->rmconf->xauth->login->l - 1);
1534
1535 if (iph1->rmconf->xauth->pass) {
1536 /* A key given through racoonctl */
1537 pwd = iph1->rmconf->xauth->pass;
1538 } else {
1539 if ((pwd = getpskbyname(usr)) == NULL) {
1540 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1541 "No password was found for login %s\n",
1542 iph1->rmconf->xauth->login->v);
1543 vfree(usr);
1544 return NULL;
1545 }
1546 /* We have to free it before returning */
1547 freepwd = 1;
1548 }
1549 vfree(usr);
1550
1551 iph1->rmconf->xauth->state |= XAUTH_SENT_PASSWORD;
1552 dlen = pwd->l;
1553
1554 break;
1555 case XAUTH_MESSAGE:
1556 if ((ntohs(attr->type) & ISAKMP_GEN_TV) == 0) {
1557 dlen = ntohs(attr->lorv);
1558 if (dlen > 0) {
1559 mraw = (char*)(attr + 1);
1560 mdata = binsanitize(mraw, dlen);
1561 if (mdata == NULL) {
1562 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, iph1->remote,
1563 "Cannot allocate memory\n");
1564 return NULL;
1565 }
1566 plog(LLV_NOTIFY,LOCATION, iph1->remote,
1567 "XAUTH Message: '%s'.\n",
1568 mdata);
1569 racoon_free(mdata);
1570 }
1571 }
1572 return NULL;
1573 default:
1574 plog(LLV_WARNING, LOCATION, NULL,
1575 "Ignored attribute %s\n", s_isakmp_cfg_type(type));
1576 return NULL;
1577 break;
1578 }
1579
1580 if ((buffer = vmalloc(sizeof(*attr) + dlen)) == NULL) {
1581 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1582 "Cannot allocate memory\n");
1583 goto out;
1584 }
1585
1586 attr = (struct isakmp_data *)buffer->v;
1587 if (ashort) {
1588 attr->type = htons(type | ISAKMP_GEN_TV);
1589 attr->lorv = htons(value);
1590 goto out;
1591 }
1592
1593 attr->type = htons(type | ISAKMP_GEN_TLV);
1594 attr->lorv = htons(dlen);
1595 data = (char *)(attr + 1);
1596
1597 switch(type) {
1598 case XAUTH_USER_NAME:
1599 /*
1600 * iph1->rmconf->xauth->login->v is valid,
1601 * we just checked it in the previous switch case
1602 */
1603 memcpy(data, iph1->rmconf->xauth->login->v, dlen);
1604 break;
1605 case XAUTH_USER_PASSWORD:
1606 memcpy(data, pwd->v, dlen);
1607 break;
1608 default:
1609 break;
1610 }
1611
1612out:
1613 if (freepwd)
1614 vfree(pwd);
1615
1616 return buffer;
1617}
1618
1619vchar_t *
1620isakmp_xauth_set(iph1, attr)
1621 struct ph1handle *iph1;
1622 struct isakmp_data *attr;
1623{
1624 int type;
1625 vchar_t *buffer = NULL;
1626 struct xauth_state *xst;
1627 size_t dlen = 0;
1628 char* mraw = NULL, *mdata;
1629
1630 if ((iph1->mode_cfg->flags & ISAKMP_CFG_VENDORID_XAUTH) == 0) {
1631 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1632 "Xauth mode config set but peer "
1633 "did not declare itself as Xauth capable\n");
1634 return NULL;
1635 }
1636
1637 type = ntohs(attr->type) & ~ISAKMP_GEN_MASK;
1638
1639 switch(type) {
1640 case XAUTH_STATUS:
1641 /*
1642 * We should only receive ISAKMP mode_cfg SET XAUTH_STATUS
1643 * when running as a client (initiator).
1644 */
1645 xst = &iph1->mode_cfg->xauth;
1646 switch (iph1->approval->authmethod) {
1647 case OAKLEY_ATTR_AUTH_METHOD_HYBRID_RSA_I:
1648 case OAKLEY_ATTR_AUTH_METHOD_XAUTH_PSKEY_I:
1649 case OAKLEY_ATTR_AUTH_METHOD_XAUTH_RSASIG_I:
1650 /* Not implemented ... */
1651 case OAKLEY_ATTR_AUTH_METHOD_HYBRID_DSS_I:
1652 case OAKLEY_ATTR_AUTH_METHOD_XAUTH_DSSSIG_I:
1653 case OAKLEY_ATTR_AUTH_METHOD_XAUTH_RSAENC_I:
1654 case OAKLEY_ATTR_AUTH_METHOD_XAUTH_RSAREV_I:
1655 break;
1656 default:
1657 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1658 "Unexpected XAUTH_STATUS_OK\n");
1659 return NULL;
1660 break;
1661 }
1662
1663 /* If we got a failure, delete iph1 */
1664 if (ntohs(attr->lorv) != XAUTH_STATUS_OK) {
1665 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1666 "Xauth authentication failed\n");
1667
1668 evt_phase1(iph1, EVT_PHASE1_XAUTH_FAILED, NULL);
1669
1670 iph1->mode_cfg->flags |= ISAKMP_CFG_DELETE_PH1;
1671 } else {
1672 evt_phase1(iph1, EVT_PHASE1_XAUTH_SUCCESS, NULL);
1673 }
1674
1675
1676 /* We acknowledge it */
1677 break;
1678 case XAUTH_MESSAGE:
1679 if ((ntohs(attr->type) & ISAKMP_GEN_TV) == 0) {
1680 dlen = ntohs(attr->lorv);
1681 if (dlen > 0) {
1682 mraw = (char*)(attr + 1);
1683 mdata = binsanitize(mraw, dlen);
1684 if (mdata == NULL) {
1685 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, iph1->remote,
1686 "Cannot allocate memory\n");
1687 return NULL;
1688 }
1689 plog(LLV_NOTIFY,LOCATION, iph1->remote,
1690 "XAUTH Message: '%s'.\n",
1691 mdata);
1692 racoon_free(mdata);
1693 }
1694 }
1695
1696 default:
1697 plog(LLV_WARNING, LOCATION, NULL,
1698 "Ignored attribute %s\n", s_isakmp_cfg_type(type));
1699 return NULL;
1700 break;
1701 }
1702
1703 if ((buffer = vmalloc(sizeof(*attr))) == NULL) {
1704 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1705 "Cannot allocate memory\n");
1706 return NULL;
1707 }
1708
1709 attr = (struct isakmp_data *)buffer->v;
1710 attr->type = htons(type | ISAKMP_GEN_TV);
1711 attr->lorv = htons(0);
1712
1713 return buffer;
1714}
1715
1716
1717void
1718xauth_rmstate(xst)
1719 struct xauth_state *xst;
1720{
1721 switch (xst->authtype) {
1722 case XAUTH_TYPE_GENERIC:
1723 if (xst->authdata.generic.usr)
1724 racoon_free(xst->authdata.generic.usr);
1725
1726 if (xst->authdata.generic.pwd)
1727 racoon_free(xst->authdata.generic.pwd);
1728
1729 break;
1730
1731 case XAUTH_TYPE_CHAP:
1732 case XAUTH_TYPE_OTP:
1733 case XAUTH_TYPE_SKEY:
1734 plog(LLV_WARNING, LOCATION, NULL,
1735 "Unsupported authtype %d\n", xst->authtype);
1736 break;
1737
1738 default:
1739 plog(LLV_WARNING, LOCATION, NULL,
1740 "Unexpected authtype %d\n", xst->authtype);
1741 break;
1742 }
1743
1744#ifdef HAVE_LIBLDAP
1745 if (xst->udn != NULL)
1746 racoon_free(xst->udn);
1747#endif
1748 return;
1749}
1750
1751int
1752xauth_rmconf_used(xauth_rmconf)
1753 struct xauth_rmconf **xauth_rmconf;
1754{
1755 if (*xauth_rmconf == NULL) {
1756 *xauth_rmconf = racoon_malloc(sizeof(**xauth_rmconf));
1757 if (*xauth_rmconf == NULL) {
1758 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1759 "xauth_rmconf_used: malloc failed\n");
1760 return -1;
1761 }
1762
1763 (*xauth_rmconf)->login = NULL;
1764 (*xauth_rmconf)->pass = NULL;
1765 (*xauth_rmconf)->state = 0;
1766 }
1767
1768 return 0;
1769}
1770
1771void
1772xauth_rmconf_delete(xauth_rmconf)
1773 struct xauth_rmconf **xauth_rmconf;
1774{
1775 if (*xauth_rmconf != NULL) {
1776 if ((*xauth_rmconf)->login != NULL)
1777 vfree((*xauth_rmconf)->login);
1778 if ((*xauth_rmconf)->pass != NULL)
1779 vfree((*xauth_rmconf)->pass);
1780
1781 racoon_free(*xauth_rmconf);
1782 *xauth_rmconf = NULL;
1783 }
1784
1785 return;
1786}
1787
1788struct xauth_rmconf *
1789xauth_rmconf_dup(xauth_rmconf)
1790 struct xauth_rmconf *xauth_rmconf;
1791{
1792 struct xauth_rmconf *new;
1793
1794 if (xauth_rmconf != NULL) {
1795 new = racoon_malloc(sizeof(*new));
1796 if (new == NULL) {
1797 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1798 "%s: malloc failed\n", __func__);
1799 return NULL;
1800 }
1801
1802 memcpy(new, xauth_rmconf, sizeof(*new));
1803
1804 if (xauth_rmconf->login != NULL) {
1805 new->login = vdup(xauth_rmconf->login);
1806 if (new->login == NULL) {
1807 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1808 "%s: malloc failed (login)\n", __func__);
1809 goto out;
1810 }
1811 }
1812 if (xauth_rmconf->pass != NULL) {
1813 new->pass = vdup(xauth_rmconf->pass);
1814 if (new->pass == NULL) {
1815 plog(LLV_ERROR, LOCATION, NULL,
1816 "%s: malloc failed (password)\n", __func__);
1817 goto out;
1818 }
1819 }
1820
1821 return new;
1822 }
1823
1824 return NULL;
1825out:
1826 vfree(new->login);
1827 racoon_free(new);
1828 return NULL;
1829}
